channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: First Afrikaners granted refugee status due to arrive in U.S.
item.description: Three months ago, President Trump signed an executive order telling white Afrikaans South Africans they could apply for refugee status in the U.S. The...

item.title: 5/8: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about the U.S. cardinal elected Pope Leo XIV; Reporter's Notebook: Shared hope for the new pope

item.title: Who is Robert Prevost, the new Pope Leo XIV?
item.description: Pope Leo XIV has supported his predecessor and focus will turn on whether he continues Church reforms.

item.title: Trump hails framework of U.K. trade deal, but 10% tariffs will remain on some items
item.description: President Trump said in remarks from the Oval Office that the two countries are "affirming that reciprocity and fairness is an essential and vital pri...

item.title: Conclave elects Pope Leo XIV as first American to lead the Catholic Church | Special Report
item.description: Chicago-born Cardinal Robert Prevost, who will take the name Pope Leo XIV, was elected as the new leader of the Catholic Church. Leo, 69, was chosen o...

item.title: Trump fires longtime Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden
item.description: Carla Hayden has been the Librarian of Congress since 2016. She was the first woman and African American to hold the position.

item.title: Almost 60 cases dropped due to corruption in an Alabama police department
item.description: Almost five dozen criminal cases will no longer be prosecuted because they were tainted by rampant corruption in a northern Alabama police department.

item.title: 'There is no truce': Ukraine's soldiers and civilians on Russia's ceasefire
item.description: The BBC's Yogita Limaye went to the Donetsk region of Ukraine to speak to soldiers about life on the frontline.

item.title: New Pope Has Ties To U.S. and Peru
item.description: The world's 1.4 billion Catholics now have a new pope. Robert Prevost, who was born in Chicago and spent two decades of service to the church in Peru ...

item.title: FEMA's acting administrator is replaced a day after congressional testimony
item.description: The abrupt change came the day after Cameron Hamilton testified on Capitol Hill that he did not agree with proposals to dismantle an organization that...

item.title: India and Pakistan trade attacks amid risk of war between nuclear states
item.description: The escalation began after India accused Pakistan of being behind an attack where gunmen killed 26 people, mostly tourists, in India-administered Kash...

item.title: Who is the new Pope Leo XIV and what are his views?
item.description: Pope Leo XIV was born and raised in Chicago. He is of French, Italian and Spanish descent. He spent years working as a missionary in Peru.

item.title: Up to 1,000 transgender troops are being moved out of the military in new Pentagon order
US cuts aid to Zambia over 'systematic' medicine theft
item.description: Critical medicines affected by the $50m cuts include Malaria, HIV and TB drugs, the US embassy says.

item.title: Bill Gates plans to give away most of his fortune by 2045
item.description: Microsoft founder said he will speed up his charitable giving - and accused Elon Musk and Doge of "killing children" through aid cuts.

item.title: Melania Trump hosts White House event to unveil Barbara Bush postage stamp
US and UK agree deal slashing Trump tariffs on cars and metals
item.description: It will leave a 10% import tax on most goods shipped from the UK to the US.

item.title: Catholic Chicagoans celebrate as native son Pope Leo XIV becomes first American pope
item.description: Catholic Chicagoans gathered in churches, cheered from classrooms and celebrated from their homes as the historic decision was announced that a native...
